questionsAndAnswers.subject: ComfyUI-Cloud
questionsAndAnswers.question: Where can I find the 'Generate on Cloud' button after installing the custom node?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: You will find the 'Generate on Cloud' button on your right-hand panel below the 'Queue Prompt' button.

questionsAndAnswers.subject: ComfyUI-Cloud
questionsAndAnswers.question: What should I do to start using ComfyUI-Cloud?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: You need to create an account to start using ComfyUI-Cloud.

questionsAndAnswers.subject: ComfyUI-Cloud
questionsAndAnswers.question: What happens after I name and upload my workflow?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: The custom node will search for models, custom nodes, and images your workflow relies on and upload them to your cloud. It may take some time, especially if your workflow uses many custom nodes and models.

questionsAndAnswers.subject: ComfyUI-Cloud
questionsAndAnswers.question: Where does the ComfyUI-Cloud node look for models, custom nodes, and images?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: The ComfyUI-Cloud node exclusively searches for these within your ComfyUI folder. If you use models from Automatic1111 installation via extra_model_paths.yaml, you must move the models inside ComfyUI and deactivate Comfy's extra_model_paths.yaml.

questionsAndAnswers.subject: ComfyUI-Cloud
questionsAndAnswers.question: What happens after the upload process?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: A Comfy Cloud node will be created in your workflow, automatically executing your workflow in the cloud once. If you delete this Comfy Cloud node, you will need to re-upload your workflow.

questionsAndAnswers.subject: ComfyUI-Cloud
questionsAndAnswers.question: How can I access cloud workflow runs?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: You can access all cloud workflow runs by clicking the blue 'View past runs' button in your Comfy Cloud node.

questionsAndAnswers.subject: ComfyUI-Cloud
questionsAndAnswers.question: Where can I find my most recent generation, and what information will be displayed?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: To locate your most recent generation, scroll to the bottom of the table that pops up after clicking 'View past runs' and select the item with the latest timestamp. If your workflow requires significant time for generation, it will display progress, iterations per second, an estimated time for completion, and an option to halt execution.

questionsAndAnswers.subject: ComfyUI-Cloud
questionsAndAnswers.question: What will happen to my charges if I halt my workflow execution?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: Charges will only apply up to the point of termination.

questionsAndAnswers.subject: ComfyUI-Cloud
questionsAndAnswers.question: Where will the generated image be displayed?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: Upon successful generation, the panel will automatically display your generated image.
